    • Uses of Point3D in Coords

      Methods in Coords that return Point3D 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Point3D coords_converter.add​(Point3D gps, Point3D local_vector_in_meter)
      computes a new point which is the gps point transformed by a 3D vector (in meters)
      Point3D GpsCoord.add​(Point3D meterVector)  
      Point3D MyCoords.add​(Point3D gps0, Point3D local_vector_in_meter)
      adding a meter vector to the GPS coordinate and returning the new GPS coordinate after the sum
      NOTE: if the point the method got as input doesn't represent a valid GPS coordinate the method will return its value as is without any changes, if the addition of the vector made the point invalid GPS coordinate, the method will return points first value as we got as input
      Point3D GpsCoord.getInternalPoint()  
      Point3D coords_converter.vector3D​(Point3D gps0, Point3D gps1)
      computes the 3D vector (in meters) between two gps like points
      Point3D GpsCoord.vector3D​(Point3D inputGpsInternalPoint)
      calculates the difference 3D vector between two points
      Point3D MyCoords.vector3D​(Point3D gps0, Point3D gps1)
      calculating the meter vector between two GPS coordinates
      NOTE: in case one of the input values is not a valid GPS the method will return its value, in case both point are invalid the method will return null
      Methods in Coords with parameters of type Point3D 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Point3D coords_converter.add​(Point3D gps, Point3D local_vector_in_meter)
      computes a new point which is the gps point transformed by a 3D vector (in meters)
      Point3D GpsCoord.add​(Point3D meterVector)  
      Point3D MyCoords.add​(Point3D gps0, Point3D local_vector_in_meter)
      adding a meter vector to the GPS coordinate and returning the new GPS coordinate after the sum
      NOTE: if the point the method got as input doesn't represent a valid GPS coordinate the method will return its value as is without any changes, if the addition of the vector made the point invalid GPS coordinate, the method will return points first value as we got as input
      double[] coords_converter.azimuth_elevation_dist​(Point3D gps0, Point3D gps1)
      computes the polar representation of the 3D vector be gps0-->gps1 Note: this method should return an azimuth (aka yaw), elevation (pitch), and distance
      double[] MyCoords.azimuth_elevation_dist​(Point3D gps0, Point3D gps1)
      returning a double type array where [0]=> is the azimuth between given gps0 and gps1
      [1]=> is the elevation between gps0 and gps1
      [2]=> is the distance between gps0 and gps1
      NOTICE: this method won't work for two coordinates which are too distant, the MAX distance is defined to be 200km, if one or more of the input GPS coords is invalid the method will return null
      double MyCoords.distance2d​(Point3D gps0, Point3D gps1)
      method we created although it hasn't been found in the interface, this helps us to handle 2D distance in GPS points (in case the altitude difference dosen't matter)
      double GpsCoord.distance2D​(Point3D p)  
      double coords_converter.distance3d​(Point3D gps0, Point3D gps1)
      computes the 3D distance (in meters) between the two gps like points
      double MyCoords.distance3d​(Point3D gps0, Point3D gps1)
      calculating the distance between two GPS point using the formula from given excel file which is calculated in vector3D method
      NOTICE: the max distance this method can calculate is 200 km, any distance bigger than this will return NaN to indicate that the method didn't calculate a thing, in case one or more of the input points dosen't represent a valid GPS point the method will return NaN as well
      double GpsCoord.distance3D​(Point3D p)  
      boolean coords_converter.isValid_GPS_Point​(Point3D p)
      return true iff this point is a valid lat, lon , lat coordinate: [-180,+180],[-90,+90],[-450, +inf]
      boolean MyCoords.isValid_GPS_Point​(Point3D p)
      checking whether given GPS point is valid by values, NOTICE : altitude is check based on dead sea lowest altitude which is (-430) [according to:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dead_Sea] and mount everest highest altitude which is 8,848 [according to:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mount_Everest]
      Point3D coords_converter.vector3D​(Point3D gps0, Point3D gps1)
      computes the 3D vector (in meters) between two gps like points
      Point3D GpsCoord.vector3D​(Point3D inputGpsInternalPoint)
      calculates the difference 3D vector between two points
      Point3D MyCoords.vector3D​(Point3D gps0, Point3D gps1)
      calculating the meter vector between two GPS coordinates
      NOTE: in case one of the input values is not a valid GPS the method will return its value, in case both point are invalid the method will return null
